body: So what effect do you want? Do you want to get tooltip on scatters or not?
https://echarts.apache.org/zh/option.html#xAxis.axisLabel.showMaxLabel
@GEMINI-SYSU Thanks for reporting! Do you mind making a pull request to fix it?

I think we should add a new feature to provide the sum value in label/tooltip formatter because I've seen several requirements like this.

Hi! We've received your issue and please be patient to get responded. ğŸ‰
The average response time is expected to be within one day for weekdays.

In the meanwhile, please make sure that **you have posted enough image to demo your request**. You may also check out the [API](http://echarts.apache.org/api.html) and [chart option](http://echarts.apache.org/option.html) to get the answer.

An ad-hoc could be adding `grid: { top: 0 }`. But I'm not sure why this bug happens.
@100pah What's the consideration of current implementation?

@GEMINI5516 Math.log10 may have compatibility issue in some browsers, like IE.

I think the calculated result needs to be rounded to avoid precision issue.

@100pah what about using String.length instead?

And I think it's not necessary to consider `quantityExponent(0)`, cause this function was used with Math.pow, as `Math.pow(10, quantityExponent(val))` . If val is 0, then `Math.pow(10, quantityExponent(val)) = 0`
Hi, do you have any suggestions for a quick-patch I can implement to fix this issue? Sadly this is blocking us to use echarts in production

@ITAYC0HEN Hi, Sorry for the late reply.

I added a layout option: `'friction'`. It will slow down the nodes' movement. So we can try setting a smaller value when we update the option on dataZoom. Like following

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/841551/65154158-9352c680-da5d-11e9-90c2-0976f4da99f5.png)

The value ranges from 0 to 1.

I tried it in your project and it works well. [site-mock.zip](https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/files/3626698/site-mock.zip)

But this feature is still experimental and the `echarts.min.js` has been changed to our developing version. It will be planned in release 4.5.0 next month.  If you have any issue using this developing version, please let us know.

That is indeed a great band-aid that solved the issue. Thank you!
Of course, it would be great to have a proper solution but I trust you would fix it soon enough.

Thank you very much, again!

Github now has support for Draft Pull Requests that will block merging, in case you want to be on the safe side :)
https://github.blog/2019-02-14-introducing-draft-pull-requests/
@ITAYC0HEN Thanks for the very useful information!

IMO, I suppose it is not really a bug, since there's an unstack button besides. And the doc does not claim stack button has toggle effect, right ? btw, if the unstack functionality does not work, you can simple click reset button at bottom of the chart container..

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10528482/65198314-3daa0880-dab5-11e9-9997-8d4b22eec620.png)

btw, @Ovilia though the doc content has i18 multi-language, but the demo chart's toolbox tooltips do NOT have. if we can enhance the built-in tooltips with multi-language, that may help the Echarts more widely spread oversea. Thanks.

@atanasbozhkov Thanks for reporting. I think it makes sense for step line charts to have step lines with `connectNulls`.
[minSpan](https://echarts.apache.org/zh/option.html#dataZoom-inside.minSpan) and [maxSpan](https://echarts.apache.org/zh/option.html#dataZoom-inside.maxSpan)
The reset button is not part of ECharts, but a button of our demo platform. So it should work with the unstack toolbox without clicking the reset button.

@mlibbey Hi, the stack button is not a toggle button. As @alex2wong says, you should click the button beside the stack button to toggle back to the original state.
Oh, I see...

This issue has been resolved in the version 4.2.1. But the fix caused another issue https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/issues/11086 . We fixed in the commit https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/commit/de98ef690ddfc0e608c7a0e9af4d6f7b30beb0fd .It will be included in the release 4.4.0
Fixed in https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/commit/de98ef690ddfc0e608c7a0e9af4d6f7b30beb0fd
You can use some addins such as [CefSharp](https://github.com/cefsharp/CefSharp) to embed browser control in .NET WinForm and use ECharts if you do want to, though not recommended practice.

I'm seeing the same on echarts `4.1.0` and `4.3.0` and `echarts-for-react 2.0.14`, `echarts-for-react 2.0.15-beta.0`, specifically using a Pie Chart. Can this issue be re-opened?
Fixed since 4.2.1

# Issue Reason
I was passing every dynamic config to`echarts-for-react` component as a prop. Config consited of 1...3 number of series. Exception was raised when the new config doesn't consist of a series present previously and moving mouse over that series. 

# Obvious Solution
Stop the event handling when chart is updating.

# Fix 1
`Show an overlay over chart when it is updating.`
1. `chartInstance.showLoading()` when change has started. (I did it as soon as the API call for next data is triggered)
2. `chartInstance.hideLoading()` when `chartInstance.on('finished')` event.

# Fix 2
`chartInstance.setOption does the update with silent (no-event-listening) mode.`
https://www.echartsjs.com/en/api.html#echartsInstance.setOption
1. Pass initial config as prop to Echart component.
2. For next changes, use `chartInstance.setOptions(...)` instead of passing new config as prop to the component.

Hope this is of use to you guys.

Thanks, @alex2wong . The grid top is a fixed height by default. It's for the space of legend, title, toolbox or other components. Currently, this is not automatically layout. You can change the top with the option [grid.top](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#grid.top). It can be fixed height or a percent value.

About the issue @CeleKing asked. The container height is too small and it caused the grid height to a negative value. 

Perhaps we can limit the value to zero to avoid confusing. Of course, the best solution is adding automatically layout to utilize the space as much as possible.
